message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the analysis of highly cited publications in a PLOS ONE full-text corpus, which involves the use of natural language processing and information retrieval techniques. This suggests that the paper could fall under several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CY (Computers and Society). However, given the focus on citation analysis and text mining, cs.DL and cs.IR are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of IMRaD sections in citation contexts, which could be relevant to cs.CL and cs.CY. Finally, the paper's emphasis on the time perspective of highly cited papers could be relevant to cs.SI.
